010package imagingbook.common.math;
011
012//import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.MatrixUtils;
013import org.apache.commons.math3.stat.correlation.Covariance;
014
015/**
016 * This class defines static methods for statistical calculations.
017 * 
018 * @author WB
019 *
020 */
021public abstract class Statistics {
022        
023        private Statistics() {}
024        
025        /**
026         * Calculates the covariance matrix for a sequence of sample vectors.
027         * Takes a sequence of n data samples, each of dimension m.
028         * The data element {@code samples[i][j]} refers to the j-th component
029         * of sample i. No statistical bias correction is applied.
030         * 
031         * @param samples a 2D array of m-dimensional vectors (double[n][m]).
032         * @return the covariance matrix for the sample data (of dimension m x m).
033         */
034        public static double[][] covarianceMatrix(double[][] samples) {
035                return covarianceMatrix(samples, false);
036        }
037        
038        /**
039         * Calculates the covariance matrix for a sequence of sample vectors.
040         * Takes a sequence of n data samples, each of dimension m.
041         * The data element {@code samples[i][j]} refers to the j-th component
042         * of sample i. Statistical bias correction is optionally applied.
043         * 
044         * @param samples a 2D array of m-dimensional vectors (double[n][m]).
045         * @param biasCorrect If {@code true}, statistical bias correction is applied.
046         * @return the covariance matrix for the sample data (of dimension m x m).
047         */
048        public static double[][] covarianceMatrix(double[][] samples, boolean biasCorrect) {
049                Covariance cov = new Covariance(samples, biasCorrect);
050                return cov.getCovarianceMatrix().getData();
051        }
052        
053//      /** 
054//       * example from UTICS-C Appendix:
055//       * N = 4 samples
056//       * K = 3 dimensions
057//       * @param args ignored
058//       */
059//      public static void main(String[] args) {
060//              
061//              boolean BIAS_CORRECT = false;
062//              
063//              // example: n = 4 samples of dimension m = 3:
064//              // samples[i][j], i = column (sample index), j = row (dimension index).
065//              double[][] samples = { 
066//                              {75, 37, 12},   // i = 0
067//                              {41, 27, 20},   // i = 1
068//                              {93, 81, 11},   // i = 2
069//                              {12, 48, 52}    // i = 3
070//              };
071//              
072//              // covariance matrix Cov (3x3)
073//              double[][] cov = covarianceMatrix(samples, BIAS_CORRECT);
074//              System.out.println("cov = \n" + Matrix.toString(cov));
075//              
076//              System.out.println();
077//              
078//              double[][] icov = Matrix.inverse(cov);
079//              System.out.println("icov = \n" + Matrix.toString(icov));
080//              
081//              System.out.println();
082//              
083//              double trace = MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(cov).getTrace();
084//              System.out.println("trace(cov) = " + trace);
085//              double Fnorm = MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(cov).getFrobeniusNorm();
086//              System.out.println("Fnorm(cov) = " + Fnorm);
087//      }
088        
089/* Results (bias-corrected):
090cov = 
091{{1296.250, 442.583, -627.250}, 
092{442.583, 550.250, -70.917}, 
093{-627.250, -70.917, 370.917}}
094
095icov = 
096{{0.024, -0.014, 0.038}, 
097{-0.014, 0.011, -0.022}, 
098{0.038, -0.022, 0.063}}
099*/
100        
101/* verified with Mathematica
102X1 = {75, 37, 12}; X2 = {41, 27, 20}; X3 = {93, 81, 11}; X4 = {12, 48, 52};
103samples = {X1, X2, X3, X4}
104N[Covariance[samples]]
105-> {{1296.25, 442.583, -627.25}, {442.583, 550.25, -70.9167}, {-627.25, -70.9167, 370.917}}
106*/
107        
108/* Results (NON bias-corrected):
109cov = 
110{{972.188, 331.938, -470.438}, 
111{331.938, 412.688, -53.188}, 
112{-470.438, -53.188, 278.188}}
113
114icov = {{0.032, -0.019, 0.051}, 
115{-0.019, 0.014, -0.030}, 
116{0.051, -0.030, 0.083}}
117*/
118
119}
